\ELANBegin 0.000
\ELANEnd 3.449
\ELANParticipant speaker#1
\sound Clip__00_-_Archery_Interview.wav 0.000 3.449
\tx tæ    ong    u         khana  yei-thaw            chong  thaw  sah  phi
\mb tæ    ong    u         khana  ye-   i=      thaw  chong  thaw  sah  phi
\ph tɛ    ˀɔŋ ˀu       kʰana je-   ˀi=    tʰaw ʧɔŋ tʰaw saʔ pʰi
\ge nvis   say    3sg.M.nom tell   BEN-  N=      place sit    place stay 2pl
\ps deixis v      pn        v      case- clitic= n     v      n     v    pn

\ft `so he said, say/tell (us) your place where you live.'

\ELANBegin 27.260
\ELANEnd 28.402
\ELANParticipant speaker#1
\sound Clip__00_-_Archery_Interview.wav 27.260 28.402
\tx ym  æm   de       u-khih      phi  de       wi  de       ar
\mb ym  æm   de       u=   khih   phi  de       wi  de       ar
\ph m̩ ˀɛm de       ˀu= kʰiʔ pʰi de       wi  de       ˀar
\ge NEG have  neg.ints NF=  work   2pl  neg.ints one neg.ints two
\ps neg v     adv      der= v      pn   adv      num adv      num

\ft `You don't have any other work, nothing..'

\nt "ar" here refers to the number 2.'

\ref ArcheryInterviewJowai_015
\ELANBegin 28.402
\ELANEnd 29.397
\ELANParticipant speaker#2
\sound Clip__00_-_Archery_Interview.wav 28.402 29.397
\tx ym  æm   de
\mb ym  æm   de
\ph m̩ ˀɛm de
\ge NEG have  neg.ints
\ps neg v     adv

\ft `nothing else.'

\nt "æm" is a verb of existence, so the phrase above can also mean 'there isn't any of what is being discussed, in this case 'work.'

\ge QTAG
\ps q

\ft `and so when you work like this, like this, when, just now imagine, lets say, like a bet, ok?.'

\nt "ka thong" is the word for 'target but according to Olivia it refers to a bet here (perhaps slang?).'

\ps v     pn  pn      pn   prefix- v   prefix- v    pn  case- v       case- clitic= n     der= v         v     pn  case- clitic= num

\ph ka=     sɪm ka        wa  hɛʔ  bha   ka        wa  kmai     ka        wa  ʤrɔŋ
\ge F=      bird 3sg.F.acc NMZ be.big INTS1 3sg.F.acc NMZ be.great 3sg.F.acc NMZ be.tall
\ps clitic= n    pn        mod v      adv   pn        mod v        pn        mod v

\ft `i will tell you one story from Tibet in the past, once upon a time there was a bird name song and another one whom i forgot her name since it was during our
childhood, if it was this time i would have remember their name, there was a bird who was big, fat and tall,.'

\nt "ka sim ka wa hæh bha ka wa kmai kawa jrong" "ka kopsar.'

\ge become REAL CPLV   ABL-  N=      nvis   used.to NMZ carry(sling) 1pl INST M=      cone.basket NMZ be    NMZ LOC-  N=      nvis
\ps v      mood aspect case- clitic= deixis adv     mod v            pn  case clitic= n           mod v     mod case- clitic= deixis

\tx i-por        wa  man    katæ          ka-yaw         arsein             æh    chi tayaw          wa   ka-sngi      musiang wa
\mb i=      por  wa  man    ka=     tæ    ka=     yaw    ar   - sein        æh    chi ta      - yaw  wa   ka=     sngi musiang wa
\ph ˀi=    pɔr wa  man    ka=     tɛ    ka=     jaw    ˀar - seʲn       ˀɛʔ ʧi ta      - jaw  wa   ka=     sŋi musiaŋ wa
\ge N=      time NMZ become F=      nvis   F=      market two  - time,action IMM2   set CL.time - week COMT F=      day  Musiang COMT

\ps clitic= n    name    v      clitic= deixis clitic= n      mod v    v      q    v      pn      deixis case name    ints deixis v

\tx ko        ka-hæh     hi   katæ          ka-yaw         musiang.
\mb ko        ka=  hæh   hi   ka=     tæ    ka=     yaw    musiang
\ph kɔ       ka=  hɛʔ  hi   ka=     tɛ    ka=     jaw    musiaŋ

\ps pn        der= v      ints clitic= deixis clitic= n      name

\ft `Then we used carry a cone as a carry Bag to put the stuff. At that time there are only two markets in a week (for Jowai) i.e. Khyllaw and yaw Musiang;
Khyllaw market is a small market, in Jaintia yaw Musiang is the biggest market..'

\ge nvis   put,keep 3sg.F.acc ALL-  N=      medl   nvis   if   REAL become EMPH 3sg.F.acc any  nvis   return.home ALL-  N=      prox   nvis
\ps deixis v        pn        case- clitic= deixis deixis conj mood v      ints pn        ints deixis v           case- clitic= deixis deixis

\tx dæptæ         sumar     ki-sister           nga     cheini.
\mb dæp   - tæ    sumar     ki=     sister      nga     che-  i=      ni
\ph dɛp   - tɛ    sumar     ki=     sistar      ŋa     ʧe-  ˀi=    ni

\ps aspect - deixis v         clitic= English     pn      case- clitic= deixis

\ft `before (my) mother died she said "send (her) to Mookyndeng if she lives, if it happens send her there in order for the sisters to take care of me.'

\ge CPLV   - nvis   be    set be    LOC-  N=      nvis   nvis   fall 3sg.M.nom CPLV   end    hurt,sick F=      leg   lower.leg 3sg.M.nom C.TAG
\ps aspect - deixis v     num v     case- clitic= deixis deixis v    pn        aspect clitic v         clitic= n     n         pn        q

\ge F=      layer   3sg.F.acc NMZ LOC-  head      completely be    F=      space,heavens 3sg.F.acc NMZ two  be    N=      sky     3sg.F.acc NMZ three be
\ps clitic= n       pn        mod case- n         adv        v     clitic= n             pn        mod num  v     clitic= n       pn        mod num   v

\tx ka-sla       khyndaw   pyrthai.
\mb ka=     sla  khyndaw   pyrthai
\ph ka=     sla  kʰn̩daw pr̩tʰaj
\ge F=      leaf earth     world
\ps clitic= n    n         n

\ft `the uppermost layer is called sorkep, the second layer is the sky, the third layer is the earth.'

\ft `so when they live there the ..... won't be enough, they thought of going back to heaven but this will just take their time.'

\ge ABL-  N=      nvis   N=      reason NMZ BEN  M=      daloi able 3sg.M.nom BEN-    do    3sg.M.nom become ABL  F=      clan four stomach,womb
\ps case- clitic= deixis clitic= n      mod case clitic= n     v    pn        prefix- v     pn        v      case clitic= n    num  n

\tx wa  na   ka-kur       le    kyllung.
\mb wa  na   ka=     kur  le    kyllung
\ph wa  na   ka=     kur  le    kl̩luŋ
\ge NMZ ABL  F=      clan three Kyllung
\ps mod case clitic= n    num   name

\ft `since then and for that reason the le kyllung clan can become the daloi, therefore the daloi can be chosen from the soo kpoh or from the le kyllung clan" .'

\ps v       pn        aspect clitic deixis v     pn

\ge nvis   become REAL be    N=      time burn   3pl 3sg.F.acc 3sg.F.acc burn   3pl 3sg.F.acc 3sg.F.acc F=      Malngiang BEN  RES= end nvis
\ps deixis v      mood v     clitic= n    v      pn  pn        pn        v      pn  pn        pn        clitic= name      case der= v   deixis

\tx da   yoo ki-khlawait          tæ    bæh          ki  chi-tæ,    u-ni           u-syiem       malngiang man    da   yoo u
\mb da   yoo ki=     khlawait     tæ    bæh          ki  chi- tæ    u=      ni     u=      syiem malngiang man    da   yoo u
\ph da   jo  ki=     kʰlawaʲt̪ tɛ    bɛʔ         ki  ʧi- tɛ    ˀu=    ni     ˀu=    sʔem malŋiaŋ man    da   jo  ˀu
\ge REAL see PL=     warrior      nvis   trap.with.net 3pl one- nvis   M=      prox   M=      ruler Malngiang become REAL see 3sg.M.nom
\ps mood v   clitic= n            deixis v             pn  num- deixis clitic= deixis clitic= n     name      v      mood v   pn

\tx yei-tæ              wa  iñ      wa  kop       tæ    tyrha  cha  madur cha  maskut, na   madur sdang ko        cha
\mb ye-   i=      tæ    wa  iñ      wa  kop       tæ    tyrha  cha  madur cha  maskut  na   madur sdang ko        cha
\ph je-   ˀi=    tɛ    wa  ˀiɲ     wa  kɔp      tɛ    tr̩ha ʧa  madur ʧa  maskut  na   madur sdaŋ kɔ       ʧa
\ge BEN-  N=      nvis   NMZ boil,burn NMZ be.fierce nvis   flame  ALL  Madur ALL  Maskut  ABL  Madur begin 3sg.F.nom ALL
\ps case- clitic= deixis mod v         mod v         deixis n      case name  case name    case name  v     pn        case

\tx maskut da   yoo u         da   iñ      tæ    tæ    ku    u         da   u-kule        tæ    phæt  u         chi-tæ     hynrei
\mb maskut da   yoo u         da   iñ      tæ    tæ    ku    u         da   u=      kule  tæ    phæt  u         chi- tæ    hynre
\ph maskut da   jo  ˀu       da   ˀiɲ     tɛ    tɛ    ku    ˀu       da   ˀu=    kule  tɛ    pʰɛt ˀu       ʧi- tɛ    hn̩re
\ge Maskut REAL see 3sg.M.nom REAL boil,burn nvis   nvis   climb 3sg.M.nom INST M=      horse nvis   run    3sg.M.nom one- nvis   but.also
\ps name   mood v   pn        mood v         deixis deixis v     pn        case clitic= n     deixis v      pn        num- deixis conj

\tx da   tyngkha.
\mb da   tyngkha
\ph da   tŋ̩kʰa
\ge REAL hide
\ps mood v

\ft `when the time came they burn the malgngiang kingdom, then the other warriors saw that and they came along to that place, king malngiang saw the flames, felt
the heat, from madur it starts till it reached maskut, He started to fled away with his horse.'

\nt wa iñ wa kop, tyrha, hynrei da tyngkha.'

\ft `then the eleven daloi bow down to jwai, then they took malngiang's head to jwai and till now that place is known as 'thaw seh khlieh " .'

\nt (according to my understanding thaw is 'place', seh means to place the head in the spear and make the spear stand on the ground, khlieh is 'head ).'

\ft `when they came to the earth they will live and die as ynñiaw wasa did, they had to marry ynñiaw wasa. To serve their religion and be God fearing people" .'

\ge clan ABL  M=      seven    hut   BEN  NF=  CAUS-   become eight clan ABL  PL=     eight clan REF    BEN  NF=  pickup,choose BEN
\ps n    case clitic= num      n     case der= prefix- v      num   n    case clitic= num   n    clitic case der= v             case

\tx u-man       khatsoo  wasan ya   u         ya   ryngkat  khatsoo  wa  hæh.
\mb u=   man    khatsoo  wasan ya   u         ya   ryngkat  khatsoo  wa  hæh
\ph ˀu= man    kʰatso  wasan ja   ˀu       ja   rŋ̩kat kʰatso  wa  hɛʔ

\ps der= v      num      n     case pn        case v        num      mod v

\ft ` so who were those eight wasan? They were, four clans from the sookpoh, four from ynñiaw wasa, to make the eight clans. From the eight clans will be chosen
to make khatsoo wasan to equalized 14 wahæh.'

\ft `one day he went to his work as usual, he took the dao, a chiap (this is the small traditional basket, specially made for trapping fish, where the cover is made of

\ps name      case- loc  case- clitic= deixis clitic= n    clitic= name   name      v     adv   pn        case- clitic= v     n     adv

\tx ko        katwa    ka-hadem       wan  ym  yoh   daloi de       ko,       yoh   ko        du   i-sordar        donhi. ka-tæ         toh
\mb ko        kat- wa  ka=     hadem  wan  ym  yoh   daloi de       ko        yoh   ko        du   i=      sordar  donhi  ka=     tæ    toh
\ph kɔ       kat- wa  ka=     hadɛm wan  m̩ jɔʔ daloj de       kɔ       jɔʔ kɔ       du   ˀi=    sɔrdar dɔnhi ka=     tɛ    tɔʔ

\tx ka-parom        chwa   i-tæ          i-bynta.

\ge RES= tell.story before N=      nvis   N=      purpose
\ps der= v          loc    clitic= deixis clitic= n

\ft `so kong wasan took the turban from the hadem's priest, and he was given the job as a sordar only, the priest rank was given to labang nongplut ( i didn't get the
word), since then 'labang nongplut got the priest rank, whereas hadem was deprived of her rights to have the priest rank and was given only the sordar rank, so

\ps clitic= n    name           v    pn        case clitic= name      case- clitic= deixis v     clitic= n    name   deixis v      pn  pn

\ge like,want PL=     prox   PL.nmz= possible Thailand 3pl say    3pl become 1pl say    3pl by   - 1pl go   BEN  F=      mother say    3pl
\ps v         clitic= deixis der=    v        name     pn  v      pn  v      pn  v      pn  conj - pn  v    case clitic= n      v      pn

\tx 'parachai'   nei-tæ              ki  'long' ki  'yang' ki  'kat' mut   ki-tu          hapoh          Thailand hadooh

\ge among - Chai ABL-  N=      nvis   3pl life   3pl wait   3pl as    means PL=     medl   LOC-  under,in Thailand LOC-  when
\ps loc   - name case- clitic= deixis pn  n      pn  v      pn  adv   v     clitic= deixis case- loc      name     case- loc

\tx katni       dang   æm   ki-bynta        ki-bynta        yong  ki-nongkyndong         ong    ki  dang   khut  ki  kamtæ.

\ps adv- deixis aspect v     clitic= n       clitic= n       case  clitic= n              v      pn  aspect v     pn  adv-     deixis

\ft `the Thai, for 'ka-bei' they have 'ka bai', for the word 'phi lai' they have 'pailai' (let's go), then even the people's names, till now they still use words like 'chai'
'parachai' then 'long', 'yang', 'kat in the remote villages in Thailand.'

\nt "nongkyndong" is essentially the boonies, where the stereotype is that people are coarse and uneducated.'

\tx dei-yong               phareng.
\mb de-   i=      yong     phareng
\ph de-   ˀi=    jɔŋ    pʰarɛŋ
\ge INST- N=      be.black foreigner
\ps case- clitic= v        n

\ft `because in olden times if a mother gave birth on the market day known as 'mulong', the child was named as 'long', on the market day 'musiang the child was
named as 'musiang', if on 'muchai the child was named as 'chai', if on 'pyngkat the child was named as 'kat', if on 'thymbleN the child was named 'leN', if on 'hat
the child was named as 'hat', if on 'khyllaw the child was named as 'law', if on 'pynsiñ the child was named as 'siñ', the children was named after the market days
they were born on, but most of the children in modern days were named in English mostly".'

\nt (Note: in jaintia hills there are market days, these are hat, khyllaw, pyn-siñ, mulong, musiang, muchai, pyn-gkat, thymbleñ, cross check cos im not sure about their
orders )..'

\ft `concerning other places there still is maintenance, there are some people who went from here and don't know about themselves, when they reached different

'goat and they are also known as khasi khara (khasi is khasi, khara means a typical bamboo basket for keeping things), so khasi means 'the keeper', "if a question
was asked where the khasi did came from? The khasi came from the east, which is the east of khasi? it's the pnar area.'

\tx ka-palong       toh   ka        wa  kup,  tæ    la   ong    yn     i   ka-sata      toh   ka-sata      toh   ka-tupri,     ki-tæ         toh

\ph ka=     palɔŋ tɔʔ ka        wa  kup   tɛ    la   ˀɔŋ n̩    ˀi ka=     sata tɔʔ ka=     sata tɔʔ ka=     tupri ki=     tɛ    tɔʔ
\ge F=      bed     be    3sg.F.acc NMZ cover nvis   if   say    REF    1pl F=      cap  be    F=      cap  be    F=      hat   PL=     nvis   be
\ps clitic= n       v     pn        mod v     deixis conj v      clitic pn  clitic= n    v     clitic= n    v     clitic= n     clitic= deixis v

\tx ki-kyntein        yong  i   ki  wa  hadooh     katni       æm   ki  wa  tip  ki  æm   ki  wa  ym  tip  ki. Ym  sñiawthooh.
\mb ki=     kyntein   yong  i   ki  wa  ha-   dooh kat- ni     æm   ki  wa  tip  ki  æm   ki  wa  ym  tip  ki  ym  sñiawthooh
\ph ki=     kn̩teʲn jɔŋ ˀi ki  wa  ha-   doʔ kat- ni     ˀɛm ki  wa  tɪp ki  ˀɛm ki  wa  m̩ tɪp ki  m̩ sɲiawtʰoʔ
\ge PL=     word      GEN   1pl 3pl NMZ LOC-  when as-  prox   have  3pl NMZ know 3pl have  3pl NMZ NEG know 3pl NEG understand
\ps clitic= n         case  pn  pn  mod case- loc  adv- deixis v     pn  mod v    pn  v     pn  mod neg v    pn  neg v

\ft `if we say 'ka palong many will understand that it's a 'bed', but 'ka palong was the one we use to cover while sleeping ( like a blanket), and if we say 'sata which
means 'cap', many will not know about this. (they) Don't understand".

\sound Clip__23_-_PakynteinPt8LanguageChanges.wav 87.294 99.696

\mb tæ    kyndur  ka=     kyndur  toh   wa  booh     um    bih   yi    ka=  palat    kyndur  yn     ka        wa  booh     wa-     khu
\ph tɛ    kn̩dur ka=     kn̩dur tɔʔ wa  boʔ     ˀum  biʔ  ji    ka=  palat    kn̩dur n̩    ka        wa  boʔ     wa-     kʰu
\ge nvis   clay    F=      clay    be    NMZ put,keep water drink thing RES= increase clay    REF    3sg.F.acc NMZ put,keep NMZ-    hang

\tx ka-booh       tiar   ya   ki-won        ki-won        ki-tæ         ki  wa  wah   ki  sæ,  tæ    toh   i-bynta
\mb ka=  booh     tiar   ya   ki=     won   ki=     won   ki=     tæ    ki  wa  wah   ki  sæ   tæ    toh   i=      bynta
\ph ka=  boʔ     tiar   ja   ki=     wɔn  ki=     wɔn  ki=     tɛ    ki  wa  waʔ  ki  sɛ   tɛ    tɔʔ ˀi=    bn̩ta
\ge RES= put,keep things BEN  PL=     which PL=     which PL=     nvis   3pl NMZ river 3pl C.TAG nvis   be    N=      purpose
\ps der= v        n      case clitic= n     clitic= n     clitic= deixis pn  mod n     pn  q     deixis v     clitic= n

\ft `so kyndur is a room where the drinking water (in a pot) was kept, 'palat kyndur was another room for keeping the farming instrument like spade and anything
that can be hanged.'

\nt i think there's a case of homophony here or something. 'kyndur seems to describe a clay stool when attached to 'rkat (rkat kyndur), but then a storage room
here, perhaps one made of clay? or for storing things in clay pots? Then with 'palat (palat kyndur) it seems to mean a tool-room..'

\mb ka=     pyllæñ i=      kyntein   u=      ynñiaw wasa ong    i   myn            - thoo   myn            - nu    wa  beiñ         ne   wa

\ge F=      egg       N=      word      M=      seven    hut  say    1pl after,irrealis - create after,irrealis - which NMZ despise,suffer or   NMZ
\ps clitic= n         clitic= n         clitic= num      n    v      pn  mood           - v      mood           - n     mod v              conj mod

\tx khoh,   lana         lahon,       thoh    daw  soo    daw  hiam,  ya   u-tip     chynrang  kynthai   ya   u-tip

\ge peel    give.comfort give.comfort write   IRR  be.red IRR  be.red BEN  NF=  know male      female    BEN  NF=  know

\tx yei-leit                  yei-loid".
\mb ye-   i=      lait        ye-   i=      loid
\ph je-   ˀi=    lat̪       je-   ˀi=    lod̪
\ge BEN-  N=      free,escape BEN-  N=      remove
\ps case- clitic= v           case- clitic= v

\ft `when the egg was kept in its place during rituals and after the citation of rites during the ceremony, the egg was taken and was given a bath, Ynñiaw wasa's
words said 'i mynthoo mynnu, wa beñ ne wa khoh, lana lahon, thoh dawsoo daw hiem, ya u-tip chynrang kynthai ya u-tip yei-lieh yei-looh".( this ritual is maybe
for a particular ceremony like they have different rituals for different ceremonies, cross check).'

\nt everything between the quotes is part of the ceremonial language, some words are unknown even to the speaker..'

\ft `wa beñ means to speak ill about someone, wa khoh (khoh means to peel or a cone shape basket) means to tell everyone the makeup story [wa khanatang

\ft `there are other wasa's words like 'i snoom, snoom lariang phariang', what is this lariang phariang, lariang phariang means the spring water which came out of a

\tx tip  mi        u-trong,       waroh   ki-bru         toh   tip  hi   ki  u-thmat     sæ   tang     ym  tip  ki  u-trong.

\ps v    pn        clitic= n      num     clitic= n      v     v    ints pn  der= v      q     conj     neg v    pn  clitic= n

\ft `you know how to 'kña but you don't know how to 'khriam', you know how to write but you don't know how to tear, (in khasi and pnar we have the echo word
'ka-thoh ka-tar which means literature but separately thoh means write and tar means to tear), you know how to 'thmat but you don't know how to 'trong and
the same thing happened to all the people.'

\nt (u thmat u trong).'

\ref PakynteinPt08LanguageChanges_018
\ELANBegin 298.551

\mb tip  hi   u=   kheñ        tang     ym  tip  u=   kha   - ai     u=   kheñ        tip  hi   sæ   u=   kheñ        tang
\ph tɪp hi   ˀu= kʰeɲ        taŋ     m̩ tɪp ˀu= kʰa  - ˀaj   ˀu= kʰeɲ        tɪp hi   sɛ   ˀu= kʰeɲ        taŋ
\ge know EMPH NF=  ritual.action but,even NEG know NF=  birth - PTNL   NF=  ritual.action know EMPH C.TAG NF=  ritual.action but,even
\ps v    ints der= v             conj     neg v    der= v     - aspect der= v             v    ints q     der= v             conj

\tx wa  u-khaai             ym  tip  mi        mut   ka-tæ         ka-rukom       wan  ka-jingyaphær                       ka        wa
\mb wa  u=   kha   - ai     ym  tip  mi        mut   ka=     tæ    ka=     rukom  wan  ka=     jing-   ya-     phær        ka        wa
\ph wa  ˀu= kʰa  - ˀaj   m̩ tɪp mi        mut   ka=     tɛ    ka=     rukɔm wan  ka=     ʤiŋ-  ja-     pʰɛr       ka        wa
\ge NMZ NF=  birth - PTNL   NEG know 2sg.M.nom means F=      nvis   F=      way    come F=      ab.NMZ- BEN-    be.different 3sg.F.acc NMZ
\ps mod der= v     - aspect neg v    pn        v     clitic= deixis clitic= n      v    clitic= nmz-    prefix- v            pn        mod

\tx man    ka        wa  i   tang     ki-pateñ         wa  katni       ym  æm   u-paiphang           ya   ki-tæ         ki-bynta.
\mb man    ka        wa  i   tang     ki=     pateiñ   wa  kat- ni     ym  æm   u=   paiphang        ya   ki=     tæ    ki=     bynta
\ph man    ka        wa  ˀi taŋ     ki=     pateʲɲ   wa  kat- ni     m̩ ˀɛm ˀu= pajpʰaŋ       ja   ki=     tɛ    ki=     bn̩ta
\ge become 3sg.F.acc NMZ 1pl but,even PL=     generation NMZ as-  prox   NEG have  NF=  understandfully BEN  PL=     nvis   PL=     purpose
\ps v      pn        mod pn  conj     clitic= n          mod adv- deixis neg v     der= v               case clitic= deixis clitic= n

\ft `you know how to 'kheñ (to count) but you don't know how to 'khaai (cross check), and these are parts of our culture that we the present generation really don't
understand.'

\nt (u kheñ u khaai).'

\ft `these are the things which needed deep concentration so as to understand, there are two things to be concentrated, when we say 'sla (leaf) we also say 'tloor (
), when we say 'lmet (a different kind of leaf) we also 'ladaw (banana), if we say 'soiong (a kind of fruit here, black skin, marble size, flesh is maroon in color)
we also say 'sotew (this is another different kind but i think it came from the same family with the latter), if we say 'siej (bamboo) we also have to say 'chken'
(bamboo)." Note: i don't know how to differentiate this but i can just say both 'siej and 'chken are bamboo, siej is word use in khasi and ckhen in pnar..'

\ge PL=     nvis   be    go  3pl PL=     market
\ps clitic= deixis v     v   pn  clitic= n

\ps clitic= n       der= v        pn      clitic- adj      der= v        pn      mod adj      der= v        case  n     case  v

\mb u=   bah      pyn-    læh  u=   bah      pyn-    chna
\ph ˀu= baʔ     pn̩-   lɛʔ ˀu= baʔ     pn̩-   ʧna

\ps der= v        prefix- v     der= v        prefix- v

\ft ` after everything was done ??, and if the wedding is on the muchai market day, ater five days there has to be the ?ee (give) kyiad (liqour) pyn-che (introduce)?
(even christians, we followed this tradition, after the wedding, we have to visit our near relatives of both side taking along putharo, sugar and banana, so that they
will consider a bride or groom a relative, this is what we called ?lai (go) pyn-che (to introduce) kurim (spouse)? but we don't have to take along any kind of
intoxication..'

\ps deixis case- loc  case- clitic= deixis case clitic= deixis clitic= n       - English clitic= n       der= v      der= v     mod v

\tx i,  toh   u-e       kti  noh   ki  ha   ki
\mb i   toh   u=   e    kti  noh   ki  ha   ki
\ph ˀi tɔʔ ˀu= ˀe  kti  nɔʔ ki  ha   ki
\ge 1pl be    NF=  give hand IMM1  3pl LOC  3pl
\ps pn  v     der= v    n    adv   pn  case pn

\ft ` so from then, for this giving clan, the family business we get, is to hand over to the female .'

\mb cha  jwai  kylleiñ  kylleiñ  dæp   tæ    nang   roi   nang   roi   kat nang   slæm   ki=     por  nang   - roi   ko
\ph ʧa  ʤwaj kl̩leɲ   kl̩leɲ   dɛp   tɛ    naŋ   roj   naŋ   roj   kat naŋ   slɛm   ki=     pɔr naŋ   - roj   kɔ
\ge ALL  Jowai throughout throughout CPLV   nvis   CONT   crawl CONT   crawl as  CONT   be.late PL=     time CONT   - crawl 3sg.F.nom
\ps case name  adv        adv        aspect deixis aspect v     aspect v     adv aspect v       clitic= n    aspect - v     pn

\tx sæ.
\mb sæ
\ph sɛ
\ge C.TAG
\ps q

\ft `according to the story told by our elders Christianity began with the coming of the missionaries from across the seas, they preached here, in jwai and all around,
it spread everywhere as time went by.';.'
